item.title: Fortnite Servers Are Down: When Will Fortnite Servers Be Back Up For Remix Chapter 2?
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/fortnite-servers-are-down-when-will-fortnite-servers-be-back-up-for-remix-chapter-2/1100-6527547/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Fortnite servers are down, but don't worry. It's all part of the plan. Fortnite servers will be back up soon; here's what you need to know.

With Fortnite's latest all-Marvel season coming to an end, it's time to look ahead to what's next, and it's poised to be another nostalgic trip down memory lane for longtime fans. Fortnite Remix Chapter 2 is imminent. Like Fortnite OG last November, this is poised to be a return (and remix, of course) of the original Chapter 2 island, complete with skins, weapons, loot, and more all fitting of that era of Epic's massive game.

Fortnite servers down - When does Fortnite Remix Chapter 2 start?

When Fortnite's servers come back up, it'll usher in this year's massive Remix season, though Epic has already revealed it will unfold for just one month before another Chapter finale event ushers in another new island in December.

The Chapter 2 map coming back will be, for some players, a bigger deal than the OG map last year, but all we can do now is wait until Epic brings Fortnite back online. But when will that be? Unfortunately, it's not a question with an easy answer, because there's no scheduled time for this maintenance window to end. Typically, you can expect to see a new Fortnite season to kick off between 7 AM and 10 AM ET on launch day--in this case, November 2--though there have been major exceptions.

Earlier this year, for example, there was some sort of technical issue that kept the game offline until late in the evening, with Fortnite staying offline for nearly a day. But that was a very unusual situation and shouldn't be expected to be repeated often.

Once the game does return, Remix Chapter 2 will introduce a whole host of changes such as a new (well, returning) map inspired by Chapter 2, vehicles fitting of that era--or perhaps no vehicles at all at first, since cars weren't added until Chapter 2 Season 3--as well as a new Remix Chapter 2 Pass that is likely to celebrate some of that era's favorite characters with mash-ups, such as Meowscles and Midas being combined into one character.

Once the servers do come back up, we'll give you a massive roundup of everything new in Fortnite Fortnite Remix Chapter 2 right here.

Mark Delaney on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: One Of The Biggest PC Game Sales Of The Year Is Live Now
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/one-of-the-biggest-pc-game-sales-of-the-year-is-live-now/1100-6527550/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Fanatical is celebrating its anniversary with a giant sale featuring thousands of games. Birthday Bash includes a bunch of 2024 games for substantial discounts, so it's worth checking out if you've been waiting for a deal on a recent release. But you'll also find older AAA games and indies for exceedingly low prices. Birthday Bash is always one of Fanatical's biggest sales each year; the quality of deals makes the event feel like an early Black Friday sale for PC games.

If you spend $12 or more on your order, you'll get a free mystery game or coupon. Keep that in mind when buying multiple games; you may want to split your picks into separate orders, as you will only receive one mystery gift per order.

We put together a long, alphabetized list of standout PC game deals below. All of the games in the list will be delivered to your account immediately as Steam keys. But even though our list features dozens of game deals, you should still browse the full Birthday Bash sale at Fanatical, because there are many other great offers--far too many to list here.

Birthday Bash runs until November 15, but make sure to check the end dates on deals you're interested in, because some offers, including flash deals, won't stick around for the full sale.

Fanatical Birthday Bash Sale

  • Ace Attorney Anthology (6 Games) -- $38.39 ($60)
  • Ace Combat 7: Skies Unknown -- $5.39 ($60)

Part of the Birthday Bash sale includes daily limited-time flash deals that offer extra savings on select titles. The sale kicked off with a flash deal on the new Silent Hill 2 remake that brings the standard edition down to just $52.49 (was $70) and the Digital Deluxe version to $62.39 (was $80). The other introductory flash deals are Frostpunk 2 for 33.74 (was $45), Lord of the Rings: Return to Moria for $17.49 (was $25), and Tales of Arise: Beyond the Dawn - Ultimate Edition for $42 (was $100). These flash sales are only available until 12pm ET / 9am PT, after which they will cycle out for a new set of flash deals.

As for the rest of the deals, you can grab a bunch of great games from big publishers like Bethesda, Sega, and Capcom for the duration of the sale. Some notable offers including Dragon's Dogma 2 for $37 (was $70) and Kunistu-gami: Path of the Goddess for $35 (was $50). This duo of Capcom games launched earlier this year, and these are the lowest prices we've seen for both.

If you recently got into the Like a Dragon (previously known as Yakuza) series with Prime Video's new TV show, you'll be pleased to know all the games in the franchise are on sale for up to 73% off during Fanatical's Birthday Bash event. While new players will want to start with Yakuza Kiwami and and Kiwami 2, which are remakes of the first two games. Meanwhile, those who need to catch up on the latest releases can grab the seventh and eighth entires Yakuza: Like a Dragon and Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth, plus the spin-off interquel, Like a Dragon Gaiden: The Man Who Changed His Name, which bridges the two, and Like a Dragon: Ishin for for $16.79.

Fanatical Game Bundles

November isn't just Fanatical's birthday month. The retailer is also running a special charity bundle deal in honor of "Movember," with the Movember Game 'Stache Charity Bundle. For jut $12, you'll get 15 PC games feature mustachioed characters, including the epic RPG Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader, city management sim Steam World Build, and the medievel PVP skirmish game Chivalry 2, just to name a few. You'll also get the Movember Handlebar Mustache cosmetic DLC pack for the WWI multiplayer FPS Isonzo.

Fanatical also has numerous other budget-friendly Steam game bundles right now, including several build-your-own bundles featuring some 2024 games and a horror game bundle. And if you're feeling lucky, there are multiple themed mystery game bundles up for grabs.

  • Build Your Own Supreme Collection: 2 for $25 / 3 for $36 / 5 for $55 -- Another Crab's Treasure, Wild Bastards, Squirrel with a Gun, High on Life, RoboCop: Rogue City, and more.
  • Build Your Own Frightmare Bundle: 2 for $6.66 / 4 for $11.68 / 6 for $16.68 -- The Evil Within, The Evil Within 2, Doom, Dead Island Definitive Collection, and more.
  • Build Your Own Prestige Collection: 2 for $15 / 3 for $22 / 5 for $35 -- Death Stranding: Director's Cut, Laika: Aged Through Blood, Amnesia: The Bunker, and more.
  • Build Your Own Play on the Go Premium Bundle: 2 for $7 / 3 for $10 / 5 for $15 -- Slash Quest, Demon Turf: Queens Edition, Coromon: Deluxe Edition, and more.
  • Adventure Mystery Bundle: 3 adventure games for $3.69
  • Strategy Mystery Bundle: 3 strategy games for $3.69
  • RPG Mystery Bundle: 3 role-playing games for $3.69
  • Ultimate Mystery Bundle: 25 games for $16

Disclosure: GameSpot and Fanatical are both owned by Fandom.

item.title: Dragon Age Creator Says The Series Has Long-Term Story Plans
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/dragon-age-creator-says-the-series-has-long-term-story-plans/1100-6527548/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

This week, Dragon Age fans have been able to dive back into the continent of Thedas in Dragon Age: The Veilguard. Longtime players may recognize that events in the game were foreshadowed in some of the previous installments. According to former Dragon Age lead writer David Gaider, that's because he laid out of the series' lore years ago in a document that's still influencing the direction of the games.

"The way I created the world was to seed plots in various parts of the world that could be part of... a single game," Gaider told Eurogamer. "Then there was the overall uber-plot, which I didn't know for certain that we would ever get to, but I had an understanding of how it all worked together... A lot of that was in my head until we were starting Inquisition and the writers got a little bit impatient with my memory or lack thereof, so they pinned me down and dragged the uber-plot out of me. I'd talked about it, I'd hinted at it, but never really spelled out how it all connected, so they dragged it out of me. We put it into a master lore doc, the secret lore, which we had to hide from most of the team."

Although Gaider left BioWare after Dragon Age: Inquisition, there are signs in The Veilguard that his original plan is still being followed, at least to a degree. He pointed to the return of Fen'Harel as a major example. However, Gaider declined to state what his original ending for the Dragon Age lore was just in case BioWare ever gets around to telling that story.

"I always had this dream of where it would all end, the very last plot," added Gaider. " But the idea that this uber-plot was this sort of biggest, finite... That the final thing you could do in this world that would break it was there as a 'Maybe we would get to do that one day.'"

Dragon Age: The Veilguard is out now on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Fortnite Remix Chapter 2 Adds Juice WRLD, Ice Spice, and Snoop Dogg Skins
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/fortnite-remix-chapter-2-adds-juice-wrld-ice-spice-and-snoop-dogg-skins/1100-6527549/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Fortnite Chapter 2 Remix kicks off on Saturday, and Epic Games finally revealed the new season on Friday night in an unusual way: with a Snoop Dogg concert in Times Square. It's only fitting for the man who is not only headlining Fortnite Festival Season 6, but who will also feature prominently in this new music-heavy retro season of battle royale.

As has long been rumored, Fortnite Chapter 5 is wrapping up with a sequel to last year's OG season. Chapter 2 Remix will, as the name implies, focus on Chapter 2--specifically the first few seasons. The season will run for just a month, ending on the evening of November 30, and will bring with it the Remix Pass. The Remix Pass is shorter than a normal battle pass at just 70 tiers, and it includes five skins that are remixes of existing skins from early Chapter 2. That's one more skin than last year's OG Pass included.

Each week of the Remix season will focus on a different artist. Week 1 is Snoop, Week 2 is Eminem--complete with a new skin inspired by his Houdini music video get-up, Week 3 is Ice Spice, and the fourth and final week will feature a tribute to the late Juice WRLD. Each week will come with themed locations and weapons in battle royale, and new item shop skins for each of the artists. And to top it all off, a cel-shaded Juice WRLD skin will be given out for free to anyone who logs in on the final day of the season, November 30, when the Remix finale event will go down.

Over in Fortnite Festival, Snoop Dogg is headlining a new Music Pass with a throwback cel-shaded skin, and he also has a bundle of item shop cosmetics as well. At 1,400 V-Bucks, this pass is cheaper than the previous Festival passes, but it still includes four jam tracks in addition to some Festival instruments. The tracks are:

  • "Robbery" by Juice WRLD
  • "Bounce Back" by Big Sean
  • "Crank That" by Soulja Boy Tell Em
  • "Young, Wild and Free" by Snoop Dogg, Wiz Khalifa and Bruno Mars

The new season of Fortnite Festival will run until January 14.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Save On Prebuilt PCs From Maingear With These Early Black Friday Deals
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/maingear-prebuilt-pc-early-black-friday-doorbusters/1100-6527541/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Black Friday is still weeks away, but thats not stopping some brands from getting a jump start on the biggest shopping holiday of the year. Maingear is one of the first to rush through the gates, with massive savings that run through December 8. Along with big discounts on four prebuilt gaming PCs, most PCs in the sale are eligible for free two-year warranties, free shipping, and a Nvidia game bundle that gets you a free copy of Star Wars Outlaws.

Most of the gaming rigs on sale are ultra-premium models equipped with the latest hardware on the market. The most enticing of the bunch might be the MG-1 4070 Super / 7800X3D, which is seeing a nice $420 discount. Along with the RTX 4070 Super and Ryzen 7 7800X3D CPU, its equipped with 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD, and Windows 11. The discount brings it to $1,877--which is a pretty great deal for all those components.

For something even more affordable, youll find the MG-1 4060 Ti / 7600X on sale for $1,388 (was $1,666). It drops you down to the RTX 4060 Ti, though its still more than capable of handling most games without any difficulty. Other notable specs include 16GB RAM, 1TB SSD, and a Ryzen 5 7600X CPU.

At the premium end of the spectrum is the MG-1 4070 Ti Super / 7800X3D for $2,833 (was $3,334). Its loaded with an RTX 4070 Ti Super, AMD Ryzen 7 7800X3D, 2TB SSD, and 48GB RAM, making it an absolute powerhouse. It also comes with a free Lian-Li Uni Fan upgrade--a bonus that cant be found on the other three models on sale.

These discounts will stick around until December 8, though Maingear notes that inventory is limited--so if one of the items is popular, it could disappear before the anticipated end date. Heres a closer look at all four products to help you decide if one is a good upgrade for your needs. Youll also find two gaming laptops up for grabs, though their deals arent quite as enticing as the prebuilt desktops.

Best Maingear Desktop Deals

  • MG-1 (RTX 4060 Ti, Ryzen 5 7600X, 16GB RAM, 1TB SSD) -- $1,388 ($1,666)
  • MG-1 (RTX 4070 Super, Ryzen 7 7800X3D, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD) -- $1,877 ($2,297)
  • MG-1 (RTX 4080 Super, Ryzen 7 7800X3D, 32GB RAM, 2TB SSD) -- $2,494 ($2,960)
  • MG-1 (RTX 4070 Ti Super, Ryzen 7 7800X3D, 48GB RAM, 2TB SSD) -- $2,833 ($3,334)
  • ML-16 Laptop (RTX 4060, Intel Core Ultra 7 155H, 16GB RAM, 1TB SSD) -- $1,699 ($1,799)
  • ML-16 Laptop (RTX 4070, Intel Core Ultra 7 155H, 32GB RAM, 2TB SSD) -- $1,977 ($2,199)
